message.body: Hello
How are you
Not bad how's things?
What do you have goin on today
How did you come up with your username? Is it a reference to something
It's hot in and I'm on my way to my final for anatomy and physiology . Oh the joy!!!!!!! My cousin from Florida is NY so I have to rush to take her someplace.
My user name? Uhh no just made it up.
What your plan for today?
I'm going out for oysters actually.
I gave to do some work from home then I'm going to meet some friends this evening. No big plans
Oh Cool where r u from?
Originally I'm from upstate ny but I live in Philly now
Oh cool. Are you in school?
No I went to school here but I finished a few years ago. Where are you from?
NY born and raised
What did you study?
I got my MFA, fine arts.
No making fun of me tho
Wow! Cool. So what is your profession?
I won't.
What do you do?
Well I work doing some linguistic processing and work at art galleries as a art handler and also do some construction stuff and occasionally work with kids on art projects.
Also I work making art with an artist group that does performances and installations and collaborate with other artists on sculpture.
Why would I laugh at that? Thats amazing! Do you enjoy doing it?
I think most people think that a fine arts education is a waste of money because there are so few jobs associated with the field. So some people think its a waste of time
I enjoy some aspects of what I do , like most people I guess.
So ur in school, what do u wana do when u get out?
Honestly. I have no clue! I should of graduated by now. I feel like I'm stuck. I change my mind so much without actually declaring. Major Bc I have no idea
back on and say I was proud of.
what I really love. I may even get a job that has nothing to so with my major nd that's fine with me, but I just want to graduate with something i can look
And I have a hunch it will not happen. What did you picture yourself doing?
I never pictured my self in a job but as more or a nomad savant, I was very impractical and naive as a young person.
Hmmm ok. So you think that being content with only CERTAIN parts of a jobs means that someone is practical and not naive?
No but I think I thought in my early 20s that I could be happy with all aspects of my occupation.
It just seems a bit silly now to think that way.
It made me make some choices that were more impractical than I would make now.
They sell majors now. I feel that the education system- especially colleges - at just taking people's money like we breathe air!
Are*
I don't want to complain too much because its been a good ride but I feel like I value security more now.
Hmmm I respect that
I was lucky to have alot of my education paid via scholarships but still have no decent job prospects.
It's not all bad just a harder life than I would have expected.
What school are you at? Is it undergrad?
